## Session Overview

Welcome to HPM 883! This session introduces the course structure, philosophy, and foundational concepts in causal inference that will underpin the entire semester.

**Format:** In-Person (Rosenau 228)

**Learning Objectives:**

1.  Understand the course structure, expectations, and deliverables
2.  Distinguish between prediction and causal inference tasks
3.  Introduce the "three-layer stack" for causal inference
4.  Preview the role of machine learning in modern causal inference

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Preparation

### Required Readings

**Chernozhukov et al. (2025)** — *Applied Causal Inference Powered by ML and AI*

-   **Chapter 1:** Introduction to Causal Inference (\~15 pages)
    -   [Online PDF](https://causalml-book.org/assets/chapters/CausalML_chap_1.pdf)
    -   Focus: Three-layer stack, identification vs. prediction

**Hernán & Robins (2020)** — *Causal Inference: What If*

-   **Chapter 1:** A Definition of Causal Effect (\~10 pages)
-   **Chapter 2:** Randomized Experiments (\~8 pages)
    -   [Online Book](https://miguelhernan.org/whatifbook)
    -   Focus: Potential outcomes, randomization

### Recommended

-   Pearl (2009) — "Causal inference in statistics: An overview" *Statistics Surveys*
-   Browse the [course website](/) to familiarize yourself with structure

**Estimated Reading Time:** 45-60 minutes
